subclusters.subcluster_name: Senescence-Associated Secretory Phenotype (SASP) and Inflammation Theory
Mitochondrial Dysfunction and Stress-Induced Senescence Theory
p53 Pathway-Mediated Cellular Senescence and Aging Theory
Replicative Senescence and Programmed Cellular Senescence Theory

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescence-Associated Secretory Phenotype (SASP) and Inflammation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on cellular senescence driving aging via SASP secretion, chronic inflammation, and genetic regulation of senescence pathways.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescence-Associated Secretory Phenotype (SASP) and Inflammation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes SASP as a driver of chronic inflammation and aging, regulated by DNA damage response and signaling pathways.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescence-Associated Secretory Phenotype (SASP) and Inflammation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes senescent cells and SASP as causal drivers of aging and age-related diseases with dual beneficial and detrimental roles.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescence-Associated Secretory Phenotype (SASP) and Inflammation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on senescent immune cells accumulating with age, SASP secretion, and their role in chronic inflammation and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescence-Associated Secretory Phenotype (SASP) and Inflammation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights accumulation of senescent cells, SASP secretion, and their systemic impact on aging and age-related diseases.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescence-Associated Secretory Phenotype (SASP) and Inflammation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on senescent cell accumulation, SASP, and senolytic removal as a strategy to delay aging and disease.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescence-Associated Secretory Phenotype (SASP) and Inflammation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes senescent cells in aged lungs secreting SASP factors that drive tissue remodeling and fibrosis.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescence-Associated Secretory Phenotype (SASP) and Inflammation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on SASP, anti-apoptotic pathways in senescent cells, and senolytics targeting these pathways to reduce aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescence-Associated Secretory Phenotype (SASP) and Inflammation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Discusses senescent cells in skeletal muscle, SASP effects, and senolytics improving muscle aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescence-Associated Secretory Phenotype (SASP) and Inflammation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Surveys senescent cell markers p16 and p21, SASP secretion, and dual roles of senescence in aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescence-Associated Secretory Phenotype (SASP) and Inflammation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on vascular aging driven by senescent cells producing ROS and SASP factors causing dysfunction.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Dysfunction and Stress-Induced Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Links stress hormone-induced mitochondrial dysfunction, ROS overproduction, DNA damage, and SASP-driven inflammation.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Dysfunction and Stress-Induced Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes oxidative stress from intermittent hypoxia causing telomere shortening, mitochondrial ROS, and SASP inflammation.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Dysfunction and Stress-Induced Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on mTORC1-autophagy axis dysregulation in senescence, persistent mTORC1 activation, and SASP promotion.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Dysfunction and Stress-Induced Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes PP2A decline in neural cells causing DNA damage, mitochondrial dysfunction, neural senescence, and behavioral aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Dysfunction and Stress-Induced Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Includes senescence-like phenotypes in post-mitotic brain cells with mitochondrial dysfunction, DNA damage, and SASP-like secretion.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Dysfunction and Stress-Induced Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Shows DNA damage response induces p21-dependent senescence-like phenotype in postmitotic neurons with ROS and inflammation.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: p53 Pathway-Mediated Cellular Senescence and Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on p53 tumor suppressor regulating senescence, apoptosis, and longevity assurance via DNA damage and oncogenic stress.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: p53 Pathway-Mediated Cellular Senescence and Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes p53 codon 72 polymorphism modulating p53 activity, stem cell function, cancer risk, and aging phenotypes.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: p53 Pathway-Mediated Cellular Senescence and Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes p21-dependent senescence as a key regulator distinct from p16, contributing to aging and multiple diseases.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Replicative Senescence and Programmed Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on programmed replicative senescence (Hayflick limit) as a genetically encoded aging mechanism limiting cell divisions.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Replicative Senescence and Programmed Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes replicative senescence as a gradual fibroblast-to-myofibroblast transition with fibrosis-promoting SASP.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Replicative Senescence and Programmed Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on replicative senescence limiting immune cell clonal expansion, telomere dynamics, and immune aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Replicative Senescence and Programmed Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Shows somatic replicative senescence in clonal colonial metazoans due to telomerase deficiency and telomere shortening.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Replicative Senescence and Programmed Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes Werner's syndrome accelerated telomere loss and replicative senescence as a model of premature aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Chromatin and Nuclear Architecture Remodeling in Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on nuclear reorganization, chromatin remodeling, and 3D genome changes driving senescence phenotype and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Chromatin and Nuclear Architecture Remodeling in Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes lamin B1 depletion triggering large-scale chromatin changes that regulate senescence gene expression and SASP.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Chromatin and Nuclear Architecture Remodeling in Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Links mitotic misregulation and chromosomal instability to gene misregulation and aging phenotypes.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Autophagy and Cellular Clearance Decline in Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on age-related decline in autophagy and phagocytosis impairing cellular clearance, promoting neurodegeneration and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Autophagy and Cellular Clearance Decline in Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes autophagy as a homeostatic mechanism declining with age, causing accumulation of damaged components and aging.
